questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on 'Environmental Pollution' in about 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Environment Pollution

The environment refers to the air, water and land in which people, animals and plants live. Human beings, animals, plants, air, water and soil are the main elements of the environment. These elements should be pollution free for our healthy living, But when they are polluted and their balance is disrupted, it is called environmental pollution. Nowadays, almost everywhere, our environment is getting polluted. In many places of our country, the environment has become extremely polluted. We, ourselves, are responsible for this situation. Industries and factories emit huge amount of smoke, gases and fume. Motor vehicles also emit large amount of smoke and gases. All these cause air pollution. Water is polluted from the dumping of industrial wastes and by chemical fertilizers and insecticides. Sound pollution occurs due to the indiscriminate use of vehicle horns, loud speakers, microphones, etc. Soil is polluted by harmful chemical fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides. Trees play an important role in conserving the environment. Trees absorb carbon dioxide and produce oxygen. Thus, they save the environment. But trees are being cut down for different commercial purposes. This needs to be stopped for the sake of keeping our environment healthy. Environment pollution is a great threat to our existence. It changes the world's climate and brings about different kinds of natural disasters. Thus, the world is getting unsuitable for living. To make life healthy and comfortable, we should keep the environment clean and pollution free.

questions.uddipok: Write an application to the Principal of your college for arranging a Blood Donation Program in the college to help the local hospital which is facing a shortage of blood for seriously injured patients.

sub_questions.explanation:
03 February 2026
The Principal
Feni Girls' Cadet College
Feni

Subject: Application for Arranging a Blood Donation Program.

Sir,
With due respect, I would like to state that our local hospital is facing a serious shortage of blood for injured and emergency patients. Many accident victims and seriously ill people are not getting the blood they need on time. As responsible students, we feel it is our duty to help the hospital and the people of our area, Many students are healthy, willing, and eager to donate blood. If the college organizes this program with the help of trained doctors and nurses from the hospital, it will be safe and successful. The students can donate blood, and the hospital will collect it and store it for emergency use. This program will inspire others to help people in need. We believe that such a program will bring a good name to our college and create a strong bond between the college and the community.
We, therefore, hope that you would be kind enough to take necessary measures and arrange a blood donation program in the college.

Yours obediently,
Shahzadi Binte Zarif

Roll: 03

questions.uddipok: Write a composition on 'Merits and Demerits of the Mobile Phone' in 300 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Merits and Demerits of the Mobile Phone

Mobile phones have become very popular not only in Bangladesh but also all over the world. Almost everyone has a mobile phone today. It is a device without which no one can go a day.
Mobile phones are very useful in many ways. First, we can call and send messages to our friends and family anytime. It helps us to stay connected, even if people live far away. Second, mobile phones have internet access. Students use the internet to search for information for their studies. They can also learn online and watch educational videos. Third, mobile phones help us in emergencies. If someone is sick or in danger, we can call for help immediately. Fourth, mobile phones are used for online banking and payments. People in Bangladesh can send money to each other using mobile apps like bKash and Nagad. Finally, mobile phones are useful for news and entertainment. We can know about the latest news, watch videos, or listen to music anytime.
But mobile phones also have some bad effects. Many young people use mobile phones for too long. It can harm their eyes and health. Some students waste time by playing games or chatting instead of studying. Mobile phones can also create addiction. People talk on the phone while driving, which is very dangerous. Some people use mobile phones for bad purposes like sending wrong messages or cheating others. It can create problems in families and society.
In Bangladesh, mobile phones are very helpful in connecting people, learning, and business. But we should use them carefully and wisely. We must not waste time or use them for bad purposes. Parents should guide their children about the proper use of mobile phones. If we use mobile phones in the right way, they can make our life easier and better.
In conclusion, mobile phones are a great invention, but they can be harmful if abused. We should enjoy their benefits and avoid the bad effects to live a happy and safe life in Bangladesh.
